speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M025
dialog: Oh, I don't know.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F029
dialog: What do you want from me?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M026
dialog: Every time I reach out for something I have to pull back because other people will suffer. My whole entire life, time and time after time.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F030
dialog: You're a considerate fella and there's nothing wrong in that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M027
dialog: To hell with that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F031
dialog: There's nothing wrong with it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M028
dialog: I didn't ask Annie yet.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F032
dialog: You didn't ask her yet?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M029
dialog: I wanted to get this settled first.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F033
dialog: Well, how do you know she's going to marry you? I mean, what if she feels the same way as your father?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M030
dialog: Well then I guess it's over then. But from her letters I think she's forgotten him.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M031
dialog: I'll find out. But then after it's all over we'll thrash it out with dad, right?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M032
dialog: Mom, don't avoid me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F034
dialog: You know, the trouble is you've never had enough women. No, you never did.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M033
dialog: So what? I'm not fast with women.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F035
dialog: I don't understand why it has to be her.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M034
dialog: Because it is.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F036
dialog: That's a good answer, but it doesn't answer anything.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M035
dialog: I just-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F037
dialog: I mean, you haven't seen her since the war. I mean, it's been five years.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M036
dialog: It just is. I-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M037
dialog: I grew up with her. Okay. All these years, when I think of someone I want to be my wife I think of Annie. What do you want, a diagram?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F038
dialog: No, I don't want a diagram.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F039
dialog: He thinks he's coming back. You go-go on and marry her, I mean, you're pronouncing her dead. And what's going to happen to your father, huh? I don't know. Do you?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M038
dialog: Okay. All right, then.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F040
dialog: Just, listen. Give it more thought, is all.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M039
dialog: No, I've given it three years of thought.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M040
dialog: And I thought that if I waited then dad would forget about Larry and then we could have a regular wedding and everything happy.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M041
dialog: But if I can't have that here then I'll get out.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F041
dialog: What the hell is this?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M042
dialog: I'll get out. I'll marry her somewhere else. Maybe New York.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F042
dialog: You're crazy.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M043
dialog: I've been a sucker too long. I'm through with it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F043
dialog: You're what-you're going to leave the business? But you can't do that. What the hell is this?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M044
dialog: The business. The business doesn't inspire me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F044
dialog: Oh, you have to be inspired.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M045
dialog: Yes. I like it an hour out of the day. If I have to grub for money all day long at least that evening I want it beautiful. I want a wife. I want a family. I want some kids. I want to build something I can give myself to.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M046
dialog: Now, Annie's in the middle of all that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M047
dialog: Now, where do I find it?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F045
dialog: Tell me something.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F046
dialog: You'd leave that business.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M048
dialog: Yes. On this I would.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F047
dialog: You can't do that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M049
dialog: Then help me stay here.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F048
dialog: All right, but you can't do that. You can't talk like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M050
dialog: Okay. Just-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F049
dialog: We've worked all our lives for you. Only for you, Chris. The whole shootin' match is for you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M051
dialog: Yeah, I know, I know, just help me stay here, all right?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F050
dialog: I'm going to.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F051
dialog: You just can't talk like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M052
dialog: I am thinking like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F052
dialog: I don't know you, do I?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_M053
dialog: No, you don't. I'm a pretty tough guy.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_1_F053
dialog: Yeah. I can see that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F000
dialog: Why did you invite her here?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M000
dialog: Why? Does that bother you?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F001
dialog: She's been in New York for three-and-a-half years. She don't just suddenly come and-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M001
dialog: Well, maybe, maybe he just wanted to see her.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F002
dialog: You don't travel seven hundred miles just to see.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M002
dialog: What do you mean? They lived next door to each other their entire lives. Why shouldn't he want to see her? Hey, don't look at me like that. I don't know anymore than you do.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F003
dialog: He's not going to marry her.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M003
dialog: How do you know he's even thinking about it?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F004
dialog: It's got that about it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M004
dialog: Well, so what?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F005
dialog: What's going on here, Joe?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M005
dialog: Listen, kid-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F006
dialog: She's not Larry's girl. She knows that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M006
dialog: You can't read her mind.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F007
dialog: Then why is she married? Then why isn't she married? She's been in New York and there's hundreds of single men there.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F008
dialog: I'm sure hundreds of them asked her and told her that she's foolish, but no.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F009
dialog: She's waited.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M007
dialog: How do you know why she's waited?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F010
dialog: Because she thinks like me, that's why.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F011
dialog: She's faithful as a rock, don't you know. In my worst moments I can think of her-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F012
dialog: I think again, that I'm-I'm right.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M008
dialog: Look, it's a nice day. What are we arguing for?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F013
dialog: Nobody in my house better ever dare-dare to challenge her faith. Maybe strangers, but not his father, not his brother.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M009
dialog: Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F014
dialog: Because he's not coming back. Then what do I got to live for? I'll kill myself.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M010
dialog: Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F015
dialog: Don't, don't laugh at me, don't laugh at me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F016
dialog: Look at it. Because why, when she came here and she slept in his room, the memorial broke into pieces. Look at it, look at it, Joe.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M011
dialog: All right. All right. Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F017
dialog: You got to believe, believe with me because I can't stand all alone.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M012
dialog: Okay. Just calm yourself.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F018
dialog: No, you've got to believe.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F019
dialog: Believe, Joe. You above all people have got to believe.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M013
dialog: Why me, above all?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M014
dialog: Huh?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M015
dialog: Why me above all?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F020
dialog: You got to keep believing.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M016
dialog: Look at you, you're shaking.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_F021
dialog: I can't help it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M017
dialog: What have I got to hide?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_2_M018
dialog: Huh? What the hell's the matter with you, Kate?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F000
dialog: You're the only one I know that still loves his parents.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M000
dialog: Yeah. I know. It went out of style, didn't it?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F001
dialog: No, it's all right. There's nothing wrong in that, you know.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F002
dialog: It's really lovely here. The air is sweet.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M001
dialog: You're not sorry you came?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F003
dialog: No. I'm not sorry. It's-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F004
dialog: I can't stay.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M002
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F005
dialog: Well, for one thing, your mother so much has told me to go. [LAUGHTER].

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M003
dialog: Well-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F006
dialog: Look,

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F007
dialog: you've been acting kind of, well, you know.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M004
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F008
dialog: Well, you've been embarrassed ever since I came.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M005
dialog: Yes, I guess I have been. But it's going from me now.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M006
dialog: Oh look, um, well, the thing is, I was planning on, planning on sort of sneaking up on you over a week or so, and they-they take it for granted we're all set.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F009
dialog: Yeah.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M007
dialog: How did you know?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F010
dialog: Yeah, they would. Especially your mom.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M008
dialog: Well, uh- would you want to?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M009
dialog: I, I guess that's why I asked you to come.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F011
dialog: Well, I mean,

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M010
dialog: Oh, Annie.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F012
dialog: from her opinion, why else would I come here?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M011
dialog: Annie, I love you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M012
dialog: I love you a great deal.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M013
dialog: I-I love you. I have no imagination. That's all I know how to tell it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F013
dialog: Well, I guess that's why I came.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M014
dialog: I'm embarrassing you. I didn't want to tell you it here. I wanted to go somewhere that would be brand-new to each other. It feels wrong here, don't you? This yard and this chair.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M015
dialog: I don't want to win you from anybody. I want you to be ready for me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F014
dialog: I've been ready for a long, long time.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M016
dialog: Then he's gone forever. You're sure?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F015
dialog: Look

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F016
dialog: I was almost married two years ago.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M017
dialog: Why didn't you?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F017
dialog: 'Cause you started to write me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M018
dialog: You felt something that far back?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F018
dialog: Every day since.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M019
dialog: Why didn't you let me know?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F019
dialog: Well, I don't know, you didn't write until then and then when you did, what'd you say?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F020
dialog: You always can be so ambiguous.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M020
dialog: Give me a kiss, Annie.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M021
dialog: Give me-

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M022
dialog: [LAUGHTER]. God, I kissed Annie. I kissed Annie. How long, how long I've been waiting to kiss you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F021
dialog: I don't know if I ever can forgive you for that. Why'd you wait so long? I sat in my room wondering if I was crazy for thinking about you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M023
dialog: We're going to live now. I'm going to make you so happy.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F022
dialog: Not like that, you're not.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M024
dialog: I kissed you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F023
dialog: Like Larry's brother. Do it like you, Chris.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F024
dialog: What is it?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M025
dialog: Let's drive somewhere. I want to be alone with you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F025
dialog: No. What is it? Is it your mother?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M026
dialog: No, no, no, no. Nothing like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F026
dialog: Well then tell me what's wrong. I mean, even in your letters there's something ashamed.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M027
dialog: Yeah. I guess there is. I guess I was, but uh- it's going from me now.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F027
dialog: You should tell me.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M028
dialog: I don't know where to start.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F028
dialog: But, Chris, it wouldn't work like this.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M029
dialog: You know when I went overseas. I said I was in command of a company.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F029
dialog: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M030
dialog: Well, I lost them.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F030
dialog: How many?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M031
dialog: Just about all.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F031
dialog: Geez.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M032
dialog: It takes a little while to toss that off. Because they weren't just men.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M033
dialog: For instance, one time, it had to have been raining several days. There was this one kid, he came up to me and he gave me his last pair of dry socks. Put them in my pocket.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M034
dialog: I mean, that's-that's only a little thing, but that's the kind of guys I had. They didn't just die. They killed themselves for each other. And I mean that exactly. A little more selfish and they'd still be here today.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M035
dialog: And I, and I thought something watching them go down.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M036
dialog: Everything was being destroyed, see, but there was one new thing that was being created. A kind of responsibility, man for man. You understand me?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M037
dialog: And to show that-to bring that onto the earth like some sort of monument standing right behind us where everyone could feel it and it would make a difference to him.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M038
dialog: And I came back here and it was incredible. There was no meaning in that here. The whole thing to them was a bus accident.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M039
dialog: And I went to work with dad and that rat race again. And I felt what you said-ashamed somehow. Because nobody was changed at all. It seemed to make a sucker out of a lot of guys.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M040
dialog: And I felt wrong to be alive. To drive the car, to see the new checkbook, to see the new refrigerator. I mean, you can take those things out of the war. But you got to know that when you drive that car that that came out of the love a man can have for another man. And you got to be a little bit better because of that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M041
dialog: Otherwise, what you have here is loot; and there's blood on it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M042
dialog: And I didn't want to take any of it.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M043
dialog: And I guess that included you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F032
dialog: And you still feel that way?

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M044
dialog: I want you now, Annie.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F033
dialog: Because you can't feel that way, never again, Chris. You hear me? Never. I mean, the money and me too.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F034
dialog: I mean, there's nothing wrong in that money, and your father put good planes up in the air and you should be proud of that. A man should be paid for that.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M045
dialog: Annie,

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_M046
dialog: Annie, I'm going to make a fortune for you.

speaker: Ses03F_script01_3_F035
dialog: What am I going to do with a fortune?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M000
dialog: Hey, what time is it? They're supposed to run around midnight, right? God, this is great, isn't it?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M001
dialog: Look at the night we got; couldn't be better.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M002
dialog: You know actually, I wanted to go a little further up the coast to get away from all the, the people and the lights, and uh- but I thought we'd miss it. Hey, how you doing?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F000
dialog: Fine.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M003
dialog: Oh, is that-is that-now, is that just foam, uhh, I can't even tell.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M004
dialog: Oh, though if I can't tell it probably isn't them, right? It probably would be unmistakable, wouldn't you think? Hey, how you doing?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M005
dialog: Oh, do you know what I forgot? I forgot my flashlight. How could I be so stupid. Oh, I-I should have brought my flashlight.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F001
dialog: What flashlight?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M006
dialog: Uh- you know, the flashlight. The silver one. There's only one, isn't there?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F002
dialog: That's not your flashlight; it's ours. It's mine too.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M007
dialog: Oh, well, sure.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F003
dialog: I don't understand why you're always saying oh, it's mine, it's mine. It's not like it's just your flashlight. I mean, how do you think that makes me feel?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M008
dialog: No, of course. Yours and mine. Our flashlight. Yours and mine. Mi flashlight is su flashlight. Naturally.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M009
dialog: We should have brought our flashlight. I can't believe we forgot to bring it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M010
dialog: I hope the moon stays out.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M011
dialog: Hey, do they always run during a full moon? I can't remember if it was full last year. Do you remember?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F004
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M012
dialog: Are you cold? Do you want my jacket?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M013
dialog: We should have brought the blanket. Oh, why didn't we bring the blanket? Our blanket.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M014
dialog: You know what would be good right now? A six-pack. Ah, I can't believe I forgot a six-pack. A six-pack would be just the ticket right about now.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M015
dialog: I'm so stupid. I'm like a little kid. I-it's amazing I get out of the house with my fly zipped. Oh- [LAUGHTER].

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M016
dialog: I wonder if they can hear us talk. Or hear the vibrations in the sand when we move.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F005
dialog: I'm cold.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M017
dialog: Do you want my jacket?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F006
dialog: It's past eleven, let's go home.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M018
dialog: What? Are you kidding me? We just got here. We'd miss it. What's the point of coming down there if we just turn around and go home?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F007
dialog: There is no point in coming down here.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M019
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F008
dialog: That's my point.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M020
dialog: Yeah, that's my point too.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F009
dialog: Well, so let's go.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M021
dialog: No. No, no, no, that's not my point. My point is there's no point in coming down here if we just turn around and leave.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M022
dialog: I mean, don't you want to see it?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F010
dialog: Not particularly.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M023
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F011
dialog: I don't know. I just don't.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M024
dialog: Honey, this is a natural-this is a natural phenomenon. I mean, it only happens once a year. This is, this is a great opportunity. Think about the people in Kansas. They would have to get a plane ticket and hotel reservation to come and see this. We're only forty minutes away. This is too good to pass up.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F012
dialog: Pass up what? A bunch of fish. They swim up to the beach and they flop around and they swim away and then they die.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M025
dialog: Yeah. But that moment on the beach is the highlight of their little lives. And all that flopping around is laying eggs or what you-spawning or mating or something like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M026
dialog: I mean, this is the big night for these guys. Life's last orgy.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F013
dialog: I don't know why you're getting so excited. I mean, it's not like the landing of the moon or something. It's just fish. Fish that nobody eats.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M027
dialog: Yeah, they do.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F014
dialog: Oh, God, Augie.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M028
dialog: What, okay, then it's fish that do something no other fish do. Like the swallows in Capistrano or the lemmings who throw themselves off the cliffs.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M029
dialog: There's magic here and mystery and a little bit of the unexplainable. I mean, I don't see how you cannot be interested.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F015
dialog: I'm just not. I mean, I'm sorry, it just-they're still fish to me.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M030
dialog: For real?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F016
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M031
dialog: I don't get it. The last time-the first time that we came to see it you said it was the best night of your life.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M032
dialog: And then last year when we came to see it you ran out of the house so fast that you stubbed your toe. And you didn't even notice until you got in the car.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F017
dialog: Yes, and if you also remember, I got sand in my panties. We got into an argument about nothing. You got a sore throat and we never saw the grunions.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M033
dialog: We weren't in a good spot.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F018
dialog: No, for God's sakes, we've never seen the grunions. We're not going to see them.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M034
dialog: We just weren't in a good spot, all right? This is a much better spot. I have a good instinct for these things. Look, is that-

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M035
dialog: no, that's just seaweed, isn't it? This is great, isn't it?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M036
dialog: I wouldn't miss this for anything. I mean, think about this. Okay, I know you're not interested, but just think about this for a minute.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M037
dialog: Somewhere out there there's this huge silver mass of fish heading this way. They don't know why. And we don't know why. Just some little instinctual time-release firecracker went off-went off in their bodies.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M038
dialog: And they all, all as one, turned as one and formed this line as big as the California coast and started swimming this way. Swimming as if that's the only thing that matters.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M039
dialog: You know, they didn't ask it a question. They didn't, they didn't take a vote. They didn't have an invitation or a map; they just started swimming as one.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M040
dialog: its single-mindedness with one mind. Urgency that's pure urge. You know, they don't give it a name.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M041
dialog: They don't ask it a question. They just, they just, they don't know what drives them. They just turn as one and start the swim that brings them to here

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M042
dialog: where we stand for a massive celebration of sex and death. Oh, God, I'm giving myself goosebumps. Look, I'm all-all my hairs on my arms is sticking up.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F019
dialog: Yeah, that's the wind.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M043
dialog: So what do you think?

dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_M044
dialog: About what I just said.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_1_F021
dialog: It's ridiculous.

dialog: So what do you think?

dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M001
dialog: About what I was just saying.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F001
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M002
dialog: It certainly is not. It is slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F002
dialog: It's so P.R. I mean, somebody's giving you a good bill about this wonderful event that's going to happen on the beach.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M003
dialog: Well, I'm not the only one. Look at all these people.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F003
dialog: Exactly. Everyone else is told the same thing. It keeps them feeling excited. Keeps them coming back. Keeps them thinking life's going to start at any minute now.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M004
dialog: Are we talking about the same thing?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F004
dialog: I don't care. It's still fish to me.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M005
dialog: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this wrong, but are you having your period?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F005
dialog: Augie, Goddamn it, don't ask me that. You always ask me that. Why do you ask me that? I hate it. It's insulting.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M006
dialog: Okay, then what's bugging you?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F006
dialog: Look, it's-we just-we're looking at this evening in a different way, both of us. We both have different ideas of it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M007
dialog: There's nothing to it, alright? We come down here, the grunion arrive, they do their little fish business, we go ooh, ah, look at the fish, and then they go home and we go home.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F007
dialog: It's not like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M008
dialog: We're not seeing the grunions?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F008
dialog: Look, Augie, we've never seen them. They're never going to come.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M009
dialog: We missed them twice. That's not ever.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F009
dialog: Twice is as many times as we've tried. That's ever.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M010
dialog: We'll see them this time.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F010
dialog: No, we won't.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F011
dialog: It's impossible. It's like waiting around. Waiting to see Santa Claus, you know?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F012
dialog: Like I feel like my whole life I've been just standing on this beach with my hands clasped waiting for these fish to show up and these fish never show up.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M011
dialog: God, I thought you wanted to see it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F013
dialog: I do.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F014
dialog: Look, I did. I always do. But it's like every time I try nothing ever happens.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M012
dialog: It's just fish. Nothing to get traumatized over.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F015
dialog: For God's sake, Augie, this is not about fish.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M013
dialog: I've been turning this thing over in my head trying to figure out when the point was when we took a turn for the worse, and I can't seem to pinpoint it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M014
dialog: You were fine during the phone call from Marge. Dinner was okay. Doing the dishes was no problem. Let's see. I took a shower. You were watching the news. You said Augie, I think the grunion are running. I said great, let's go. I feel lucky tonight.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M015
dialog: And so I'm getting the animals, putting the animals out in the yard. I'm putting on my jacket, getting the car out of the garage-

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F016
dialog: Do you remember the last time we came here?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F017
dialog: We thought I was pregnant.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F018
dialog: You brought a bottle of champagne.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F019
dialog: We took off our shoes and we danced barefoot in the sand. Under the moon.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F020
dialog: And you whispered so intimately in my ear so I could feel your words.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F021
dialog: Oh, that moment-that was it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F022
dialog: I told myself finally, this is how happy I'm supposed to be.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M016
dialog: Wait a minute. I got it.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F023
dialog: Dancing barefoot in the sand. Drinking out of a bottle of champagne.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M017
dialog: It was driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker, right? You said let's get some champagne, and I said time's-a-wasting or something like that.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M018
dialog: You want this to be like the other time, right? That's it. Right?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F024
dialog: I don't want to remember something.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F025
dialog: Hope for some things.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M019
dialog: Right. I got it. Of course. Listen, do you want to dance?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F026
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M020
dialog: Do you want me to get some champagne?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F027
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M021
dialog: Take off our shoes?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F028
dialog: No, no.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M022
dialog: What? What? Do you want me to breathe in your ear?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F029
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M023
dialog: Do you want to get married again? What? What? Do you want to get a divorce?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F030
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F031
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M024
dialog: A vacation?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F032
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M025
dialog: A new carpet? A poodle?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M026
dialog: A-a back rub, some ice cream, a suicide pact. What the hell do you want, Carla?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F033
dialog: I want things to turn out the way that they're supposed to be.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M027
dialog: Jesus, welcome to the human race.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M028
dialog: Did you think this is how I thought it was going to turn out? Do you think I had some great fantasy down the line? That four years down the line that we'd come to the beach and argue with each other over fish?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M029
dialog: No, I was just like you. I thought it was going to be all peaches and roses and everything great. And the wind in our hair and the sand in our toes, and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves, and we'll have three big fat rosy kids. And oh God.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M030
dialog: You know what you get? The jokes on us, baby. Because do you know what you get? Huh? Carla? Do you know what you get? You get this.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F034
dialog: This what? What is this? This is nothing.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M031
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F035
dialog: No, it's not. It's standing on the beach waiting and fighting.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M032
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F036
dialog: Things have never turned out anything the way that I thought they would be.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M033
dialog: No, I know. Me neither.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F037
dialog: I mean, this is, this is everything, and it's a lot, but

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F038
dialog: it's not something else. Do you know what I'm trying to say?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M034
dialog: Well, I'm doing the best I can.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F039
dialog: I know you are, Augie, and I know you wanted this evening to be nice, but I can't help thinking of being somewhere else.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M035
dialog: Yeah, maybe if you were with someone else too.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F040
dialog: I didn't say that.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M036
dialog: No, I know. But I know I don't make you happy.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F041
dialog: Augie, anything I do I'd rather be doing with you.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M037
dialog: Yeah?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F042
dialog: God, don't you know that? I mean, you're the one that probably wants to be with somebody else. Somebody that didn't take herself so seriously, could enjoy herself more.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M038
dialog: Actually now that you mention it, no, I don't.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F043
dialog: Well, I guess we're just in the wrong spart-spot with the right person.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M039
dialog: Seemed like a pretty good spot to me. I mean, look at the view of the moon we've got from here.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F044
dialog: I noticed that. It's beautiful.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F045
dialog: You can see right over the water.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F046
dialog: God, big old white moon.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M040
dialog: Look what we got here.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F047
dialog: You brought refreshments?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M041
dialog: It's not champagne.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F048
dialog: At least we won't need glasses.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M042
dialog: Are you still cold? Do you want to go home?

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F049
dialog: So I was thinking you might be right.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F050
dialog: Maybe this is the right place after all.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F051
dialog: I'm sorry, Augie.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M043
dialog: Shh.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M044
dialog: If we're very quiet the fish might come.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_F052
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses03F_script02_2_M045
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M000
dialog: Oh.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F000
dialog: [BREATHING]

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M001
dialog: Good God.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F001
dialog: Do you think it's them?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M002
dialog: I wonder.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F002
dialog: I mean, nobody knows we're here except for Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M003
dialog: It must be them then.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F003
dialog: What are we to do?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M004
dialog: We're all right, aren't we darling? Whatever happens.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F004
dialog: Yes. Now and always, sweet.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M005
dialog: Then I don't care.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F005
dialog: It was bound to come sooner or later.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M006
dialog: Hello? Hello? What? Ugh, wrong number.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F006
dialog: [LAUGHTER] God, it sent shivers up my spine.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M007
dialog: things that should matter dreadfully don't seem to matter at all when one's happy, do they?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F007
dialog: Um terrible thing is one can't stay happy. Well, it's true. I mean, the whole business is a very poor joke.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M008
dialog: Ooh darling, don't say that.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M009
dialog: You mean that sacred and beautiful thing, love?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F008
dialog: Yes, meaning just that.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M010
dialog: What does it all mean? That's what I ask myself in my quest for ultimate truth. What does it all mean?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F009
dialog: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M011
dialog: [LAUGHTER]. You mustn't be serious, my dear one, that's what they want.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F010
dialog: Who's they?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M012
dialog: All the futile moralists who try to make life unbearable. Laugh at them. Be flippant. Laugh at all the sacred shibboleths. Flippancy brings out the acid in their damn sweetness and light.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F011
dialog: Well, if I laugh at everything I'm going to have to laugh at us too.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M013
dialog: Ooh, certainly you must. We're figures of fun, all right.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F012
dialog: So how long is it going to last? This ludicrous, overbearing love of ours?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M014
dialog: Who knows?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F013
dialog: Shall we always want to bicker and fight?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M015
dialog: No. The fire will fade along with our passion.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F014
dialog: Oh dear, well, shall we want that?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M016
dialog: Depends on how well we play it.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F015
dialog: Well, what if happens if one of us is to die? Does the one that's left still laugh?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M017
dialog: Yes, yes. Yes, he must with all his might.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F016
dialog: Well, that's serious enough.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M018
dialog: No. No, it isn't. Death's very laughable. A cunning little mystery. All done with mirrors.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F017
dialog: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M019
dialog: So is everyone else in the long run. Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M020
dialog: Let's blow strumpets, blow-blow trumpets and squeakers and party as much as we can like small quite idiotic school children. Let's savor the delight of the moment. Come, kiss me darling, before worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F018
dialog: Elliott, worms don't pop.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M021
dialog: I don't care what you do, see? As long-you can paint yourself bright green all over and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word as long as you love me best.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F019
dialog: Thank you, dear. The same applies to you. Except that if I ever so much as catch you looking at another woman I'll kill you.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M022
dialog: Remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F020
dialog: Which particular one?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M023
dialog: The one when you bought that little painted wooden snake in the Piazza and put it in my bed.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F021
dialog: Oh Charles. That was his name. Charles. He did wiggle so beautifully.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M024
dialog: Horrible little thing. I hated it.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F022
dialog: I know you did. You threw it out the window and into the Grand Canal. I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M025
dialog: How long did that row last?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F023
dialog: It went on intermittently for days.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M026
dialog: The worst one was in Cannes when your-your curling iron burnt a hole in my dressing gown.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F024
dialog: Well, I burnt a hole in my comb too, and all the towels in the bathroom. [LAUGHTER].

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F025
dialog: yeah. And that was the first time you ever hit me.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M027
dialog: That was a rouser, wasn't it?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F026
dialog: The manager came in and found us rolling on the floor and biting and scratching like panthers. [LAUGHTER]

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M028
dialog: I didn't hit you very hard.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F027
dialog: I know. Oh man. Couldn't believe it.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M029
dialog: Oh, I will never forget his face. Ooh-rah [LAUGHTER].

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M030
dialog: We were very much younger then.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_F028
dialog: Yeah, and very much sillier.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_1_M031
dialog: Oh, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M000
dialog: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F000
dialog: You knew there was nothing in that.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M001
dialog: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F001
dialog: Presents? It was only a small trivial little broach.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M002
dialog: I remember it well. Bristling with diamonds. In the worst possible taste.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F002
dialog: Not at all. It was very pretty. And I wear it all the time. I still have it.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M003
dialog: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F003
dialog: No, I didn't. You made that up all in your jealous imagination.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M004
dialog: You must admit that he was in love with you.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F004
dialog: Just a little perhaps, but it was nothing serious.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M005
dialog: You let him kiss you. You said so.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F005
dialog: Well, what of it?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M006
dialog: What of it?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F006
dialog: Oh come on, it gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't harm me.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M007
dialog: What about me?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F007
dialog: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you'd have never known anything about it.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M008
dialog: That's a nice point of view, I must say.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F008
dialog: Well, it's true.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M009
dialog: Are you bored with this conversation?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F009
dialog: I definitely, most definitely am.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M010
dialog: So am I. Bored stiff. Want some brandy?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F010
dialog: No, thanks.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M011
dialog: I'll have a little, I think.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F011
dialog: I don't see why you want it; you've already had two glasses.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M012
dialog: No particular reason. Anyhow, they were very small ones.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F012
dialog: I don't see what's the point of going on and on about something like this.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M013
dialog: Oh, my-you can hardly call three minute liquor glasses in the evening going on and on and on.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F013
dialog: It's become a habit with you.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M014
dialog: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want some yourself at the moment.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F014
dialog: Don't be so stupid.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M015
dialog: Really, Amanda.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F015
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M016
dialog: Nothing.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M017
dialog: Going somewhere, dear?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F016
dialog: No. Just making myself fascinating for you.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M018
dialog: That reply has broken my heart.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F017
dialog: It's a woman's job to allure the man. Watch me, won't you, a minute?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M019
dialog: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F018
dialog: No, it isn't.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M020
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F019
dialog: No, it's not. I don't care.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M021
dialog: It's a pity you didn't have more brandy. It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F020
dialog: Well, it didn't seem to do such wonders with you, now did it?

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M022
dialog: Oh, snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F021
dialog: Adders don't snap, they sting.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M023
dialog: Yes, they do. They have a big bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F022
dialog: They sting.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_M024
dialog: They snap.

speaker: Ses03F_script03_2_F023

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F011
dialog: Not particularly.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M022
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F012
dialog: I don't know. I just don't.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M023
dialog: Honey, this is a natural phenomenon. It only happens once a year. I mean think about the people in Kansas, they would have to get hotel reservations and plane tickets to come and see this. We're only forty minutes away. This is too good to pass up.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F013
dialog: Pass up what? These fish swim up to shore, on the beach and then they flop around a little, they swim away and then they die.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M024
dialog: Well this is like the highlight, the one night of their lives and that flopping around, that's laying eggs or spawning or mating or whatever you call it.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M025
dialog: But this is the big night for these guys. Their last, life's last orgy.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F014
dialog: What are you getting so excited about? I mean, it's not like it's like the landing on the moon or something. I mean, it's just fish, fish that nobody eats.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M026
dialog: Yeah they do.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F015
dialog: Augie.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M027
dialog: Okay. But it's fish that do something that no other fish do. Like the swallows in Capistrano or the Lemmings that throw themselves off the cliffs, there's magic here and some mystery and a little bit of unexplainable.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M028
dialog: I mean, I can't see how you can not be interested.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F016
dialog: I'm just not.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M029
dialog: For real?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F017
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M030
dialog: I don't get it. I mean the first time we came to see it, you said it was the best night of your life.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M031
dialog: And last year when we came you ran out of the house so fast you stubbed your toe and you didn't even notice it until we got in the car.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F018
dialog: You also could remember that I got sand in my panties, we got in an argument over nothing, you got a sore throat and we didn't even get to see the Grunions.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M032
dialog: Okay. We're in a good spot.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F019
dialog: You didn't see them the first time either.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M033
dialog: We just weren't in the good spot. This is a much better spot. You know, I have a good instincts for these things.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M034
dialog: Look, is that...no is that just seaweed?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M035
dialog: You know, this is great isn't it? You know, I wouldn't trade this for anything.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M036
dialog: I mean, think about this, I know you're not interested but just think about this for a minute.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M037
dialog: Somewhere out there, there's this huge silver mass of fish heading this way, they don't why, we don't know why, they just some little instinctual fire cracker went off in their bodies...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M038
dialog: ...like and they all just turned at once and formed a line as long as the California coast and started swimming this way. They didn't, you know, they didn't make a decision, they didn't, you know, have boats or anything. No one sent them an invitation or a map, they just started swimming as if that's the only thing that matters.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M039
dialog: It's single mindedness with no mind. It's urgency that's pure urge and they don't, they don't ask it a question, they don't give it a name, they just swim.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M040
dialog: They just start swimming to this place right here where we stand for massive celebration of sex and death.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M041
dialog: Oh, I'm giving myself goose bumps. Look, all my hairs are standing up.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F020
dialog: That's the wind.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M042
dialog: [BREATHING] So what do you think?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F021
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M043
dialog: About what I just said?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_F022
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_1_M044
dialog: It certainly is not. It's

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M000
dialog: So what do you think?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F000
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M001
dialog: About what I just said?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F001
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M002
dialog: It certainly is not. It's a slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F002
dialog: It's PR. I mean, somebody sold you a good bill about this wonderful event that going to happen on the beach.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M003
dialog: I'm not the only one. Look at all these people.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F003
dialog: Yeah. Everyone else was sold the same thing. I mean, look, it keeps us excited, it keeps us coming back for more and you know, keeps us thinking life's going to start any minute now.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M004
dialog: Are we talking about the same thing?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F004
dialog: Look, I'm sorry but it's still just fish to me.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M005
dialog: I thought you wanted to see it.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F005
dialog: It's just...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F006
dialog: Look, we just have different ideas of what this night is supposed to be like.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M006
dialog: There's nothing to it. The Grunions arrive, they do their little fish business, you know? We go oh, ahh, look at the fish and they go home and we go home.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F007
dialog: For heavens sake, grow up. We're not going to see the Grunions.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M007
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F008
dialog: We never do, do we? Have we ever?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M008
dialog: Oh my gosh. We missed them twice, that's hardly ever.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F009
dialog: Okay. Twice is as many times as we've tried and that's ever.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M009
dialog: Carla, can I ask you something?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F010
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M010
dialog: Don't take this wrong but, are you having your period?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F011
dialog: Augie, god dammit, don't ask me that. You always ask me that. I hate it when you ask me that. It's insulting.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M011
dialog: What's bugging you then?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F012
dialog: Look, it's pointless. It's...we're not going to see the Grunions I mean, it's like waiting around to see Santa Claus, you know, it's...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F013
dialog: Listen, I've waiting my entire life on this beach just standing there waiting for this fish to show up and these fish never show up.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M012
dialog: I thought you wanted to see it.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F014
dialog: God, you don't understand anything.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M013
dialog: No, of course not.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F015
dialog: I do. I always do. I keep thinking, this time will be the time and it never is.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M014
dialog: Well, we're going to see it.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F016
dialog: No we won't. I mean, God, this isn't about the fish Augie.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M015
dialog: What...I've been trying to, I've been trying to figure out the point where we went wrong and I can't seem to pinpoint that moment.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M016
dialog: You were fine during the phone call with Marge, dinner was okay, doing the dishes was no problem.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M017
dialog: Let's see I took a shower, you were watching the news, you said hey, hey the Grunions are running tonight and I said great let's go, I feel lucky tonight.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M018
dialog: And then I'm putting the animals out in the yard, I'm pulling the car out of the garage, putting my jacket on.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F017
dialog: Look, do you remember the first time we came here?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F018
dialog: We thought I was pregnant.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F019
dialog: We brought a bottle of champagne and we took off our shoes and danced barefoot in the sand...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F020
dialog: Under the moon and you whispered so softly into my ear so I could feel your words.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F021
dialog: And I thought, this is it. This is how happy I'm supposed to be.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M019
dialog: Wait a minute. I've got it.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F022
dialog: What? Dancing barefoot in the sand? Drinking out of a bottle of champagne?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M020
dialog: It was in the car right? Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M021
dialog: And you said let's get some champagne and I said time's a wasting or something like that.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M022
dialog: You want this to be like the other time right? That's it right?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F023
dialog: I'd rather not remember something...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F024
dialog: Rather not hope for something.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M023
dialog: Okay, right. I got it. Sure. Of course. Listen, do you want to dance?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F025
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M024
dialog: Do you want me to get some champagne?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F026
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M025
dialog: Take off our shoes?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F027
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M026
dialog: What? Do you want me to breathe in your ear?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F028
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M027
dialog: Do you want to get married again? What? What? Do you want a divorce? A vacation? What? A carpet? A poodle? A basket of fruit? What? A suicide pact? What the hell do you want Carla?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F029
dialog: No...No...No...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F030
dialog: No...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F031
dialog: I want things to turn out the way that they're supposed to be.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M028
dialog: Welcome to the human race.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M029
dialog: Do you think that this is what I had in mind? That four years down the line that we'd get married and come to the beach and argue with each other over fish? No.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M030
dialog: I was just like you. I thought it was going to be all peaches and roses and everything great and the sand in our toes and the wind in our hair and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves and we'd have three big fat rosy kids...

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M031
dialog: ...and you know? Baby the jokes on us. Because you know what you get? Do you know what you get Carla? You get this.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F032
dialog: This what...what's this? This isn't anything. Alright. Sure. Standing on the beach, fighting and waiting.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M032
dialog: Yes it is.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M033
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F033
dialog: Cause everything isn't anything like I thought it would be.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M034
dialog: No. I know. Me neither.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F034
dialog: This is just this. You know? I mean it's a lot and everything but it isn't somewhere else. Do you know what I'm trying to say?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M035
dialog: I'm trying to do the best I can.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F035
dialog: I know you are Augie. I know you wanted this evening to be nice.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F036
dialog: I can't help thinking about being somewhere else.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M036
dialog: Maybe if you were with someone else too.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F037
dialog: I didn't say that.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M037
dialog: I know. But I know I don't make you happy.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F038
dialog: Augie, whatever I'm doing I'd rather be doing with you.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M038
dialog: Yeah?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F039
dialog: Yeah. Don't you know that?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F040
dialog: If anybody wants to be with anybody else it's probably you. Probably somebody who enjoys herself a little more and is not so hard.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M039
dialog: Actually, now that you mention it, no I don't.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F041
dialog: Well, I guess this is the wrong spot for the right people.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M040
dialog: It seemed like a good spot to me.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M041
dialog: I mean look at the view of the moon we got from here.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F042
dialog: Yeah. I noticed that. It's real pretty on the water.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F043
dialog: Big old white moon.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M042
dialog: Hey, look what we got here.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F044
dialog: Oh you brought refreshments.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M043
dialog: It's not champagne.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F045
dialog: Well at least we won't need glasses.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M044
dialog: Are you still cold? Do you want to go home?

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F046
dialog: No I'm beginning to think you might be right.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F047
dialog: I think this may be the place for us after all.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F048
dialog: I am sorry Augie.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M045
dialog: Shh. If we're very quiet the fish might come.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_F049
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses03M_script02_2_M046
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M000
dialog: Good God.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F000
dialog: Do you think it's them?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M001
dialog: I wonder.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F001
dialog: And nobody knows we're here except for Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M002
dialog: Well it must be them then.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F002
dialog: What are you going to do?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M003
dialog: We're fine right? Aren't we? Whatever happens darling.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F003
dialog: Now and always sweet.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M004
dialog: I don't care then.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F004
dialog: I mean, it was, it's bound to come out sooner or later.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M005
dialog: Hello? Hello? What?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F005
dialog: That sent shivers up my spine.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M006
dialog: No, wrong number.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M007
dialog: What are we to do if they suddenly walk in on us?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F006
dialog: Behave exquisitely.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M008
dialog: With the most perfect poise?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F007
dialog: Certainly. And I shall probably do a court courtesy.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M009
dialog: um- Things that should matter dreadfully don't seem to matter at all when one's happy do they?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F008
dialog: What is so horrible is that one cannot stay happy.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M010
dialog: Oh, darling. Don't say that.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F009
dialog: It's true. I mean, the whole business it's a very poor joke.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M011
dialog: You mean that, that sacred and beautiful thing love?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F010
dialog: Yes. I mean just that.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M012
dialog: What does that all mean? That's what I asked myself on my quest for ultimate truth. What does it all mean?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F011
dialog: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M013
dialog: [LAUGHTER] Oh, darling. You mustn't be serious, that's just what they want.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F012
dialog: Who's they?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M014
dialog: All the futile moralists who try to make life unbearable. Laugh at them. Be flippant.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M015
dialog: Laugh at all their sacred shibboleths. Flippancy brings the acid in their damn sweetness and light.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F013
dialog: So if I'm to laugh at everything then I must laugh at us too.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M016
dialog: Oh, certainly, you must. We're figures of fun alright.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F014
dialog: How long will it last? This ludicrous overbearing love of ours?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M017
dialog: Who knows?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F015
dialog: Shall we always want to bicker and fight?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M018
dialog: No. That fire will fade along with our passion.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F016
dialog: Well, dear, shall we want that?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M019
dialog: Well, it depends on how well we've played.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F017
dialog: What happens if one of us dies? I mean, does the other one still laugh?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M020
dialog: Of course, yes, yes, with all his might.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F018
dialog: That's serious enough.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M021
dialog: No. No it isn't. That's very laughable, a cunning little mystery all done with mirrors.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F019
dialog: Darling I believe you're talking nonsense.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M022
dialog: Oh, and who isn't talking nonsense?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M023
dialog: Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers hmmm? Let's blow trumpets and squeakers and party as much as we can like quite idiotic school children.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M024
dialog: Let's savor the delight of the moment. Come kiss me darling before worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F020
dialog: Elliot, worms don't pop.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M025
dialog: I don't care what you do, you see? As long, no I don't care what you do, see?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M026
dialog: You can put green paint all over your body and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word as long as you love me best.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F021
dialog: Thank you dear. The same applies to you...

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F022
dialog: ...only if you ever so much as look at another woman I'll kill you.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M027
dialog: Remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F023
dialog: Which particular one?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M028
dialog: The one when you bought a little painted wooden snake in the Piazza and put it in my bed.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F024
dialog: Charles, that was his name, Charles. Oh, God he was so wiggled so beautifully.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M029
dialog: Horrible little thing.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F025
dialog: Yeah. I know you did. You threw it out the window and into the Grand Canal. I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M030
dialog: I hated it.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M031
dialog: How long did that rile last?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F026
dialog: It went on intermittently for days.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M032
dialog: Oh, the worst one was in Cannes when you-

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F027
dialog: I burnt a hole in my comb too and all the towels in the bathroom.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M033
dialog: you're curling iron burnt a hole in my dressing gown.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M034
dialog: That was a rouser wasn't it?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F028
dialog: [LAUGHTER] Yeah. That was the first time you ever hit me.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M035
dialog: I didn't hit you very hard.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F029
dialog: The manager came in and saw us rolling on the floor, scratching and biting like panthers.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M036
dialog: I will never forget his face. Ooh-rah [LAUGHTER].

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F030
dialog: How ridiculous. How utterly, utterly ridiculous.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M037
dialog: We were very much younger then.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_F031
dialog: And much sillier too.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_1_M038
dialog: The real cause of that rile was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M000
dialog: Yes. The real cause of that rile was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F000
dialog: Oh, come on, you knew there was nothing in that.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M001
dialog: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F001
dialog: Presents? A trivial little broach.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M002
dialog: Mmm Hmm. I remember it well. Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F002
dialog: Not at all. It was very pretty. I still have it and I wear it often.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M003
dialog: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F003
dialog: No I didn't. You made up the whole thing in your jealous imagination.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M004
dialog: You must admit he was in love with you.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F004
dialog: Just a little perhaps but nothing serious.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M005
dialog: You let him kiss you. You said so. What of it?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F005
dialog: Well what of it?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F006
dialog: Well it didn't harm him, in fact, it pleasured him a lot and it didn't hurt me.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M006
dialog: And what about me?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F007
dialog: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you would've never known anything.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M007
dialog: Oh, that's a nice point of view I must say.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F008
dialog: Look, I'm bored with this conversation.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M008
dialog: Yeah, so am I. Bored stiff.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M009
dialog: You want some brandy?

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F009
dialog: No thanks.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M010
dialog: I'll have a little I think.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F010
dialog: I don't know why you want it. You've already had two glasses.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M011
dialog: No particular reason. Anyhow they were very small ones.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_F011
dialog: I don't see what you have to go on and on with this kind of thing.

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M012
dialog: Oh my...just because I just...okay...

speaker: Ses03M_script03_2_M013
dialog: ...having three small minute liquor glasses in the evening is hardly going on and on and on.
